zh: 这是我唯一的书。

en: Our teacher frequently overlooked the names of people on the list.
zh: 我们的老师经常忽略名单上的人名。

en: I caught up with them soon.
zh: 我很快赶上了他们。

en: They were seen to go out.
zh: 有人看见他们出去了。

en: We talked until two.
zh: 我们聊到两点。

en: Our Web site, http://www.example.com will tell you all you need to know.
zh: 我们的网站，http://www.example.com 会告诉你所有你需要知道的信息。

en: He is not any taller than I am.
zh: 他并不比我高。

en: My idea is worth reading.
zh: 我的想法值得一读。

en: I want to know if my baggage is going to arrive.
zh: 我想知道我的行李是否会到达。

en: Where do I claim my baggage?
zh: 我在哪里领取我的行李？

en: I lend money.
zh: 我借钱。

en: He wants to go to America.
zh: 他想去美国。

en: I read all kinds of books.
zh: 我读各种各样的书。

en: I don't like this quiet necktie. Please show me a more colourful one.
zh: 我不喜欢这条素色的领带。请给我看一条颜色更鲜艳的。

en: I regret going there.
zh: 我后悔去那里。

en: I always take a bath before going to bed.
zh: 我总是在睡觉前洗澡。

en: You'll learn in time that a stitch in time saves nine.
zh: 你会及时明白，及时行事，事半功倍。

en: We will stand by you whatever happens.
zh: 无论发生什么事，我们都会支持你。

en: I dislike cold weather.
zh: 我不喜欢寒冷的天气。

en: I'm feeling sick.
zh: 我觉得不舒服。

en: I'm a bank clerk.
zh: 我是银行职员。

en: I continued to work all morning.
zh: 我整个上午都在继续工作。

en: I am going to Osaka station.
zh: 我要去大阪站。

en: The little girl made a polite bow to me.
zh: 那个小女孩很有礼貌地向我鞠躬。

en: I am hungry because I did not eat lunch.
zh: 我饿了，因为我没吃午饭。

en: I could not understand anything he said.
zh: 我完全听不懂他在说什么。

en: I don't know his address.
zh: 我不知道他的地址。

en: I jog through Central Park every morning at 6 a.m.
zh: 我每天早上六点在中央公园慢跑。

en: I catch the flu every year.
zh: 我每年都会得流感。

en: We are sorry we can't help you.
zh: 很抱歉，我们无法帮助您。

en: The game became exciting.
zh: 比赛变得激动人心起来。

en: Where can I find toothpaste?
zh: 哪里可以找到牙膏？

en: My bicycle was stolen.
zh: 我的自行车被偷了。

en: It's really stinky.
zh: 真的很臭。

en: I take it back.
zh: 我收回我说的话。

en: There's no evidence.
zh: 没有证据。

en: Unbelievable!
zh: 难以置信！

en: I'm sorry, but it's impossible.
zh: 很抱歉，这是不可能的。

en: God created the world in six days.
zh: 上帝在六天内创造了世界。

en: Kobe is the city which I was born in.
zh: 神户是我出生的城市。

en: We cannot control other people's tongues.
zh: 我们无法控制别人的舌头。

en: A burglar broke into the convenience store last month, but I heard the police caught him yesterday.
zh: 上个月一个小偷闯入了便利店，但我听说警察昨天抓住了他。

en: I bought it last week.
zh: 我上周买的。

en: The river runs through the town.
zh: 这条河流经城镇。

en: The towels are dirty.
zh: 毛巾很脏。

en: Would you close the window?
zh: 你可以关一下窗户吗？

en: The loss adds up to $1,000,000.
zh: 损失总计达一百万美元。

en: The sun has just sunk below the horizon.
zh: 太阳刚刚沉入地平线以下。

en: The president abolished slavery.
zh: 总统废除了奴隶制。

en: It was a great help!
zh: 真是帮了大忙了！

en: Anyone who comes can be admitted.
zh: 任何人来都可以被允许进入。

en: Who'd know that?
zh: 谁会知道呢？

en: The boy kept quiet.
zh: 那个男孩保持沉默。

en: The ground is still wet.
zh: 地面仍然是湿的。

en: It's been raining since morning.
zh: 从早上开始就一直在下雨。

en: Drowning men clutch at straws.
zh: 落水者抓救命稻草。

en: Mr. Tanaka can play the piano well.
zh: 田中先生钢琴弹得很好。

en: I cannot stop thinking of the stolen money.
zh: 我一直想着被偷的钱。

en: In those days, I was accustomed to taking a walk before breakfast.
zh: 那时，我习惯于早餐前散步。

en: The Tokugawa Shogunate came to an end in 1868.
zh: 德川幕府在1868年结束。

en: I went on reading.
zh: 我继续读下去。

en: Cast pearls before swine.
zh: 对牛弹琴。

en: The cat is sleeping on the chair.
zh: 猫正在椅子上睡觉。

en: Two little squirrels, a white squirrel and a black squirrel, lived in a large forest.
zh: 两只小松鼠，一只白色的松鼠和一只黑色的松鼠，住在一片大森林里。

en: In case he gives me a phone call, tell him that I will call him back.
zh: 如果他打电话给我，告诉我会给他回电话。

en: Grab him.
zh: 抓住他。

en: I can hardly hear him.
zh: 我几乎听不见他说话。

en: His letter makes me uneasy.
zh: 他的信让我感到不安。

en: His object is to pass the test.
zh: 他的目标是通过考试。

en: His courage impressed me enough for me to trust him.
zh: 他的勇气给我留下了深刻的印象，足以让我信任他。

en: He is the eldest.
zh: 他是老大。

en: He is about thirty.
zh: 他大概三十岁左右。

en: He drinks too much.
zh: 他喝酒太多了。

en: He came close to losing an eye.
zh: 他差点失去一只眼睛。

en: He usually comes in time.
zh: 他通常会及时赶到。

en: He usually goes to work at 8 a.m.
zh: 他通常早上八点去上班。

en: He had no clothes other than what he was wearing.
zh: 除了身上穿的，他没有别的衣服了。

en: He was delighted to see you.
zh: 他很高兴见到你。

en: He absents himself from any party she is likely to attend.
zh: 凡是她可能参加的聚会，他都缺席。

en: He often quotes Milton.
zh: 他经常引用弥尔顿的话。

en: He has a naturally good memory.
zh: 他天生记忆力好。

en: He was billed to appear as Romeo.
zh: 他原定出演罗密欧。

en: They decided to settle in a suburb of London.
zh: 他们决定在伦敦郊区定居。

en: What is he driving at?
zh: 他到底想说什么？

en: He seems to be rich now.
zh: 他现在似乎很有钱。

en: He is wearing sunglasses.
zh: 他戴着太阳镜。

en: He wouldn't allow me to drive his car.
zh: 他不允许我开他的车。

en: He doesn't speak our language.
zh: 他不会说我们的语言。

en: He is above asking questions.
zh: 他不屑于问问题。

en: He was experienced in business.
zh: 他很有经商经验。

en: He set the alarm before going to bed.
zh: 他睡觉前设了闹钟。

en: He is going to buy a new bicycle next week.
zh: 他下周打算买一辆新自行车。

en: He was foolish enough to believe it.
zh: 他傻到相信了。

en: He was educated by her grandfather.
zh: 他由她的祖父教育长大。

en: He is breathing hard.
zh: 他呼吸很急促。

en: He possessed a large house and two cars.
zh: 他拥有一栋大房子和两辆车。

en: I remember seeing her once.
zh: 我记得见过她一次。

en: He drew up to her.
zh: 他走到她面前。

en: He doctored his report.
zh: 他篡改了他的报告。

en: His arrogance led to his downfall.
zh: 他的傲慢导致了他的垮台。

en: He was called away on business.
zh: 他因公事被叫走了。

en: The ship was at the mercy of the storm.
zh: 这艘船任由暴风雨摆布。

en: I resent his rude attitude.
zh: 我讨厌他粗鲁的态度。

en: They are able to speak Spanish a little.
zh: 他们能说一点西班牙语。

en: They have already finished the work.
zh: 他们已经完成了工作。

en: They compared the new car with the old one.
zh: 他们把新车和旧车进行了比较。

en: They are very interested in astronomy.
zh: 他们对天文学非常感兴趣。

en: They appreciate my effort.
zh: 他们感谢我的努力。

en: She is able to speak ten languages.
zh: 她能说十种语言。

en: By the time you get out of prison, she'll have been married.
zh: 等你出狱的时候，她可能已经结婚了。

en: She can't even speak her native language without making mistakes.
zh: 她甚至不能说好她的母语，总是出错。

en: We didn't stay home yesterday.
zh: 我们昨天没待在家里。

en: She has a marvelous sense of humor.
zh: 她很有幽默感。

en: Her lovely voice was a real feast to the ears.
zh: 她那美妙的声音真是一种听觉上的享受。

en: She has buried her only son.
zh: 她埋葬了她唯一的儿子。

en: She will become a doctor in two years.
zh: 两年后她会成为一名医生。

en: They might be taller than you.
zh: 他们可能比你高。

en: She isn't poor.
zh: 她不穷。

en: She hurt her elbow when she fell down.
zh: 她摔倒时伤到了手肘。

en: She wanted to go out anyway.
zh: 反正她也想出去。

en: She bought a chicken.
zh: 她买了一只鸡。

en: She happily granted my request.
zh: 她愉快地答应了我的请求。

en: He put his hand on his heart.
zh: 他把手放在胸口。

en: She came in through the back door lest she be seen.
zh: 她从后门进来，以免被人看见。

en: Go out of the room at once.
zh: 立刻从房间出去。

en: She stayed there for a moment.
zh: 她在那里待了一会儿。

en: She abandoned her son to his fate.
zh: 她抛弃了她的儿子，任其自生自灭。

en: She refused to accept his proposal.
zh: 她拒绝接受他的求婚。

en: She made arrangements to get him into a good hospital.
zh: 她安排把他送进一家好医院。

en: He hugged her.
zh: 他拥抱了她。

en: I don't need it.
zh: 我不需要它。

en: I know.
zh: 我知道。

en: Beats me.
zh: 我不知道。

en: You'll be OK.
zh: 你会没事的。

en: Talk to me!
zh: 跟我说说！

en: I was not a good mother.
zh: 我不是一个好母亲。

en: Mother is two years older than Father.
zh: 母亲比父亲大两岁。

en: You don't have to wrap it up.
zh: 你不必把它包起来。

en: Do you know where my watch is?
zh: 你知道我的手表在哪里吗？

en: He doesn't like us.
zh: 他不喜欢我们。

en: The boy reading a book is John.
zh: 那个正在看书的男孩是约翰。

en: Please call me at seven tomorrow morning.
zh: 请明天早上七点给我打电话。

en: Come to see me at any time tomorrow afternoon.
zh: 明天下午随时来看我。

en: I'd like a wake-up call at six tomorrow morning.
zh: 我想要明天早上六点的叫醒服务。

en: Do you have blankets?
zh: 你们有毯子吗？

en: What would you like for supper?
zh: 晚饭想吃什么？

en: The point is that you didn't teach them grammar.
zh: 重点是你们没有教他们语法。

en: No, I suppose not.
zh: 不，我想也是。

en: Both of the parents did try hard in search of their daughter.
zh: 这对父母都努力地寻找他们的女儿。

en: My parents live at ease in the country.
zh: 我的父母在乡下过着舒适的生活。

en: The girl and her parents were very sympathetic.
zh: 这个女孩和她的父母都非常同情。

en: Find a good job.
zh: 找个好工作。

en: Call me at six-thirty, please.
zh: 请六点半给我打电话。

en: First, we decide on that which needs to be decided, then we split into two teams.
zh: 首先，我们决定需要决定的事情，然后我们分成两队。

en: No sign of the enemy in our surroundings.
zh: 我们周围没有敌人的踪迹。

en: Good morning!
zh: 早上好！

en: I live in this neighborhood.
zh: 我就住在这个社区。

en: I live near here.
zh: 我就住在附近。

en: The conclusion reached by a study is "People who think their feet are smelly, have smelly feet; people who think they aren't, don't."
zh: 一项研究得出的结论是“认为自己脚臭的人，脚就是臭的；认为自己脚不臭的人，脚就是不臭的。”

en: Pigeons, if trained, can differentiate paintings of Picasso from those of Monet.
zh: 鸽子如果经过训练，可以区分毕加索和莫奈的画作。

en: It seems that it's impossible to distinguish an obsessional neurosis from an intense love from a biochemical perspective.
zh: 从生物化学的角度来看，似乎无法区分强迫性神经症和强烈的爱。

en: It was determined that the picking of one's nose is a completely normal act for adolescent boys.
zh: 经确定，挖鼻孔对于青春期男孩来说是一种完全正常的行为。

en: Among wild ducks, it seems there are homosexual necrophiliacs.
zh: 在野鸭中，似乎存在同性恋恋尸癖。

en: It was proven that fleas living on dogs jump higher than fleas living on cats.
zh: 已经证明，生活在狗身上的跳蚤比生活在猫身上的跳蚤跳得更高。

en: It's been a long time coming, but tonight, because of what we did on this day, in this election, at this defining moment, change has come to America.
zh: 这一天终于到来了，但今晚，因为我们今天所做的事情，在这场选举中，在这个决定性的时刻，变革已经降临美国。

en: I just received a very gracious call from Senator McCain.
zh: 我刚刚接到了麦凯恩参议员非常亲切的电话。

en: He has endured sacrifices for America that most of us cannot begin to imagine.
zh: 他为美国做出了我们大多数人无法想象的牺牲。

en: It can't happen without you, without a new spirit of service, a new spirit of sacrifice.
zh: 没有你们，没有一种新的服务精神，一种新的牺牲精神，这一切都不会发生。

en: And that cannot happen if we go back to the way things were.
zh: 如果我们回到过去，这一切就不会发生。

en: It is only the chance for us to make that change.
zh: 这仅仅是我们做出改变的机会。

en: This victory alone is not the change we seek.
zh: 单凭这次胜利，并不能带来我们所寻求的改变。

en: What began 21 months ago in the depths of winter cannot end on this autumn night.
zh: 21个月前在寒冬深处开始的事情，不能在这个秋夜结束。

en: And, above all, I will ask you to join in the work of remaking this nation, the only way it's been done in America for 221 years — block by block, brick by brick, calloused hand by calloused hand.
zh: 最重要的是，我希望你们加入到重建这个国家的工作中来，就像过去221年来在美国所做的那样——一块砖一块砖地，用长满老茧的双手一点一滴地建设。

en: I will listen to you, especially when we disagree.
zh: 我会倾听你们的意见，尤其是在我们意见不一致的时候。

en: But I will always be honest with you about the challenges we face.
zh: 但我将始终坦诚地告诉你们我们所面临的挑战。

en: And we know the government can't solve every problem.
zh: 我们知道政府不能解决所有问题。

en: There are many who won't agree with every decision or policy I make as president.
zh: 很多人不会同意我作为总统所做的每一个决定或政策。

en: There will be setbacks and false starts.
zh: 会有挫折和错误的开始。

en: I promise you, we as a people will get there.
zh: 我向你们保证，我们作为一个民族会到达那里。

en: But, America, I have never been more hopeful than I am tonight that we will get there.
zh: 但是，美国，我从未像今晚这样充满希望，相信我们会到达那里。

en: We may not get there in one year or even in one term.
zh: 我们可能不会在一年内，甚至一个任期内到达那里。

en: The road ahead will be long.
zh: 前方的道路将是漫长的。

en: There's new energy to harness, new jobs to be created, new schools to build, and threats to meet, alliances to repair.
zh: 有新的能量需要利用，新的工作需要创造，新的学校需要建造，以及需要应对的威胁，需要修复的联盟。

en: Our climb will be steep.
zh: 我们的攀登将是陡峭的。

en: There are mothers and fathers who will lie awake after the children fall asleep and wonder how they'll make the mortgage or pay their doctors' bills or save enough for their child's college education.
zh: 有些父母会在孩子们入睡后仍然醒着，想知道他们如何支付抵押贷款、支付医疗费用或为孩子的大学教育存够钱。

en: Even as we stand here tonight, we know there are brave Americans waking up in the deserts of Iraq and the mountains of Afghanistan to risk their lives for us.
zh: 即使我们今晚站在这里，我们也知道有勇敢的美国人正在伊拉克沙漠和阿富汗山区醒来，为我们冒着生命危险。

en: For even as we celebrate tonight, we know the challenges that tomorrow will bring are the greatest of our lifetime — two wars, a planet in peril, the worst financial crisis in a century.
zh: 即使我们今晚庆祝，我们也知道明天将带来的挑战是我们一生中最大的挑战——两场战争，一个处于危险中的星球，一个世纪以来最严重的金融危机。

en: You did it because you understand the enormity of the task that lies ahead.
zh: 你们这样做是因为你们理解摆在我们面前的任务的艰巨性。

en: And I know you didn't do this just to win an election.
zh: 我知道你们这样做不仅仅是为了赢得选举。

en: And I know you didn't do it for me.
zh: 我也知道你们这样做不是为了我。

en: This is your victory.
zh: 这是你们的胜利。

en: It drew strength from the not-so-young people who braved the bitter cold and scorching heat to knock on doors of perfect strangers, and from the millions of Americans who volunteered and organized and proved that more than two centuries later a government of the people, by the people, and for the people has not perished from the Earth.
zh: 它从那些不那么年轻的人们身上汲取了力量，他们冒着严寒酷暑敲响陌生人的家门，也从数百万志愿组织起来的美国人身上汲取了力量，他们证明了两个多世纪后，民有、民治、民享的政府没有从地球上消失。

en: It grew strength from the young people who rejected the myth of their generation's apathy … who left their homes and their families for jobs that offered little pay and less sleep.
zh: 它从那些拒绝了他们那一代人冷漠的神话的年轻人身上汲取了力量……他们离开了家和家人，去从事报酬微薄、睡眠不足的工作。

en: It was built by working men and women who dug into what little savings they had to give $5 and $10 and $20 to the cause.
zh: 它是靠工人们用他们仅有的一点积蓄捐出5美元、10美元和20美元来建立的。

en: It began in the backyards of Des Moines and the living rooms of Concord and the front porches of Charleston.
zh: 它始于得梅因的后院、康科德的客厅和查尔斯顿的前廊。

en: Our campaign was not hatched in the halls of Washington.
zh: 我们的竞选活动不是在华盛顿的殿堂里策划的。

en: We didn't start with much money or many endorsements.
zh: 我们一开始没有多少钱，也没有多少支持。

en: I was never the likeliest candidate for this office.
zh: 我从来都不是这个职位最有可能的候选人。

en: But above all, I will never forget who this victory truly belongs to. It belongs to you. It belongs to you.
zh: 但最重要的是，我永远不会忘记这场胜利真正属于谁。它属于你们。它属于你们。

en: I am grateful to them.
zh: 我感谢他们。

en: To my sister Maya, my sister Alma, all my other brothers and sisters, thank you so much for all the support that you've given me.
zh: 致我的姐姐玛雅，我的姐姐阿尔玛，我所有的其他兄弟姐妹，非常感谢你们给予我的所有支持。

en: I miss them tonight. I know that my debt to them is beyond measure.
zh: 今晚我很想念他们。我知道我对他们的亏欠是无法估量的。

en: And while she's no longer with us, I know my grandmother's watching, along with the family that made me who I am.
zh: 虽然她已经不在我们身边了，但我知道我的祖母正在看着，还有那些造就我的家人。

en: And you have earned the new puppy that's coming with us … to the White House.
zh: 你们赢得了即将和我们一起去白宫的新小狗。

en: Sarah and Marsha - I love you both more than you can imagine.
zh: 萨拉和玛莎——我爱你们胜过你们的想象。

en: And I would not be standing here tonight without the unyielding support of my best friend for the last 16 years, the rock of our family, the love of my life, the nation's next first lady, Michelle Obama.
zh: 如果没有我过去16年里最好的朋友、我们家庭的支柱、我一生的挚爱、我们国家未来的第一夫人米歇尔·奥巴马坚定不移的支持，我今晚就不会站在这里。

en: I want to thank my partner in this journey, a man who campaigned from his heart, and spoke for the men and women he grew up with on the streets of Scranton, and rode with on the train home to Delaware, the vice president-elect of the United States, Joe Biden.
zh: 我想感谢我这次旅程的伙伴，一个用心竞选的人，他为他在斯克兰顿街头一起长大的人们发声，他乘坐火车回家乡特拉华州，他就是美国当选副总统乔·拜登。

en: We are better off for the service rendered by this brave and selfless leader.
zh: 我们因这位勇敢无私的领导人所提供的服务而变得更好。

en: If there is anyone out there who still doubts that America is a place where all things are possible; who still wonders if the dream of our founders is alive in our time; who still questions the power of our democracy, tonight is your answer.
zh: 如果还有人怀疑美国是否是一个一切皆有可能的地方；如果还有人怀疑我们开国元勋的梦想是否在我们这个时代依然鲜活；如果还有人质疑我们民主的力量，今晚就是你的答案。

en: While the Democratic Party has won a great victory tonight, we do so with a measure of humility and determination to heal the divides that have held back our progress.
zh: 虽然民主党今晚赢得了伟大的胜利，但我们怀着谦逊和决心来弥合阻碍我们进步的分歧。

en: So let us summon a new spirit of patriotism, of responsibility, where each of us resolves to pitch in and work harder and look after not only ourselves but each other.
zh: 因此，让我们唤起一种新的爱国主义精神、一种责任感，让我们每个人都决心尽一份力量，更加努力地工作，不仅照顾好自己，而且照顾好彼此。

en: Let us remember that, if this financial crisis taught us anything, it's that we cannot have a thriving Wall Street while Main Street suffers.
zh: 让我们记住，如果这场金融危机教会了我们什么，那就是当华尔街繁荣时，主街却在受苦，这是行不通的。

en: In this country, we rise or fall as one nation, as one people.
zh: 在这个国家，我们作为一个国家，作为一个民族，同甘共苦。

en: Let's resist the temptation to fall back on the same partisanship and pettiness and immaturity that has poisoned our politics for so long.
zh: 让我们抵制住诱惑，不要再回到长期以来毒害我们政治的党派之争、小气和不成熟。

en: Let's remember that it was a man from this state who first carried the banner of the Republican Party to the White House, a party founded on the values of self-reliance and individual liberty and national unity.
zh: 让我们记住，正是来自这个州的一个人，首先将共和党的旗帜带到了白宫，这个政党建立在自力更生、个人自由和国家团结的价值观之上。

en: Those are values that we all share.
zh: 这些是我们共同拥有的价值观。

en: As Lincoln said to a nation far more divided than ours, we are not enemies but friends.
zh: 正如林肯对一个比我们更加分裂的国家所说的那样，我们不是敌人，而是朋友。

en: Though passion may have strained, it must not break our bonds of affection.
zh: 虽然激情可能会紧张，但它绝不能破坏我们之间的感情纽带。

en: And to those Americans whose support I have yet to earn, I may not have won your vote tonight, but I hear your voices.
zh: 对于那些我尚未赢得支持的美国人，我今晚可能没有赢得你们的选票，但我听到了你们的声音。

en: I need your help. And I will be your president, too.
zh: 我需要你的帮助。而且我也会成为你们的总统。

en: And to all those watching tonight from beyond our shores, from parliaments and palaces, to those who are huddled around radios in the forgotten corners of the world, our stories are singular, but our destiny is shared, and a new dawn of American leadership is at hand.
zh: 对于今晚在海外关注我们的人们，从议会到宫殿，到那些在世界被遗忘的角落里围坐在收音机旁的人们，我们的故事是独特的，但我们的命运是共同的，美国领导的新时代即将到来。

en: To those — to those who would tear the world down: We will defeat you.
zh: 对于那些想要摧毁世界的人：我们将击败你们。

en: To those who seek peace and security: We support you.
zh: 对于那些寻求和平与安全的人：我们支持你们。

en: To all those who have wondered if America's beacon still burns as bright: Tonight we proved once more that the true strength of our nation comes not from the might of our arms or the scale of our wealth, but from the enduring power of our ideals: democracy, liberty, opportunity and unyielding hope.
zh: 对于所有那些想知道美国的灯塔是否仍然明亮的人：今晚我们再次证明，我们国家真正的力量不是来自我们武器的力量或我们财富的规模，而是来自我们理想的持久力量：民主、自由、机会和永不放弃的希望。

en: That's the true genius of America: that America can change.
zh: 这就是美国真正的天才之处：美国可以改变。

en: Our union can be perfected.
zh: 我们的联盟可以被完善。

en: At a time when women's voices were silenced and their hopes dismissed, she lived to see them stand up and speak out and reach out for the ballot.
zh: 在女性的声音被压制，她们的希望被忽视的时代，她亲眼目睹她们站起来，发出声音，并争取投票权。

en: And tonight, I think about all that she's seen throughout her century in America — the heartache and the hope; the struggle and the progress; the times we were told that we can't, and the people who pressed on with that American creed: Yes we can.
zh: 今晚，我想到了她在美国的一个世纪里所看到的一切——心痛和希望；奋斗和进步；我们被告知我们不能的时代，以及那些坚持美国信条的人们：是的，我们可以。

en: She was born just a generation past slavery; a time when there were no cars on the road or planes in the sky; when someone like her couldn't vote for two reasons — because she was a woman and because of the color of her skin.
zh: 她出生在奴隶制结束后的几代人之后；那时路上没有汽车，天上没有飞机；像她这样的人不能投票有两个原因——因为她是女性，也因为她的肤色。

en: She's a lot like the millions of others who stood in line to make their voice heard in this election except for one thing: Ann Nixon Cooper is 106 years old.
zh: 她很像数百万其他排队参加这次选举并发出声音的人，但有一点不同：安·尼克松·库珀已经106岁了。

en: One that's on my mind tonight is about a woman who cast her ballot in Atlanta.
zh: 今晚我想到的一件事是关于一位在亚特兰大投票的女性。

en: This election had many firsts and many stories that will be told for generations.
zh: 这次选举有很多第一次，也有很多故事会被世代传颂。

en: What we've already achieved gives us hope for what we can and must achieve tomorrow.
zh: 我们已经取得的成就让我们对明天我们能够而且必须取得的成就充满希望。

en: He's not serious.
zh: 他不是认真的。

en: I will try.
zh: 我会尽力的。

en: He's thought long and hard for this election. Very long and hard for the country he loves.
zh: 他为这次选举深思熟虑了很久。为了他所热爱的国家，他深思熟虑了很久。

en: Such pretty flowers!
zh: 多么漂亮的花啊！

en: Are you listening to me at all?
zh: 你到底有没有在听我说话？

en: Shall we go to the cinema?
zh: 我们去看电影好吗？

en: Most people think computers will never be able to think.
zh: 大多数人认为电脑永远无法思考。

en: Is it splendid, this world?
zh: 这个世界很精彩，不是吗？

en: Sounds great, I'll have a look afterwards.
zh: 听起来不错，我之后会看看。

en: Since I don't have a job, I can't save money.
zh: 因为我没有工作，所以我存不了钱。

en: What is the date today?
zh: 今天几号？

en: With no work, I can't save any money.
zh: 没有工作，我存不了钱。

en: Without work, I can't save anything.
zh: 没有工作，我什么都存不了。

en: Good evening.
zh: 晚上好。

en: I should stop procrastinating.
zh: 我应该停止拖延了。

en: I am Chinese.
zh: 我是中国人。

en: Good morning.
zh: 早上好。

en: See with your ears.
zh: 用耳朵看。

en: Today, I want to go home already.
zh: 今天，我已经想回家了。

en: I want to go back now.
zh: 我现在想回去。

en: In places where it snows a lot, kerosene is an indispensable item.
zh: 在经常下雪的地方，煤油是不可或缺的物品。

en: I will wash my car in a hand car wash today.
zh: 今天我要去人工洗车店洗车。

en: The doors of the train on line 3 are closing. Please be careful.
zh: 地铁三号线的车门正在关闭。请注意安全。

en: I go to school every day by bus.
zh: 我每天坐公共汽车去学校。

en: Today, I was done with my homework early.
zh: 今天，我早早地就做完了作业。

en: Formerly, this city was beautiful.
zh: 以前，这座城市很漂亮。

en: For the holidays, I'm going to Tokyo for a week.
zh: 假期我要去东京一周。

en: The train leaves in 5 minutes.
zh: 火车五分钟后出发。

en: All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights. They are endowed with reason and conscience and should act towards one another in a spirit of brotherhood.
zh: 人人生而自由，在尊严和权利上一律平等。他们赋有理性和良心，并应以兄弟关系的精神相对待。

en: My mother was a Japanese National Railways station attendant from 1971 until 1987.
zh: 我母亲从1971年到1987年是日本国铁的车站服务员。

en: He swallowed detergent by mistake.
zh: 他错误地吞下了清洁剂。

en: He drank detergent by mistake.
zh: 他错误地喝了清洁剂。

en: Can I rest a bit?
zh: 我可以休息一下吗？

en: There's a splendid park in the centre of the town.
zh: 镇中心有一个很棒的公园。

en: UN stands for United Nations.
zh: UN是联合国的意思。

en: "UN" stands for "United Nations".
zh: “UN”是“联合国”的意思。

en: How many magazines are on the desk?
zh: 桌子上有多少本杂志？

en: He holds great influence with the Association of Medical Sciences.
zh: 他在医学科学协会拥有很大的影响力。

en: A hundred and fifty diplomats came to that conference.
zh: 一百五十位外交官参加了那次会议。

en: That museum has a superb collection of Celtic era cultural artifacts.
zh: 那家博物馆收藏了精美的凯尔特时代文化文物。

en: Rock, paper, scissors.
zh: 石头，剪刀，布。

en: There sure are a lot of people at Sensouji.
zh: 浅草寺的人真多啊。

en: The Shitennouji is the most ancient temple in Japan.
zh: 四天王寺是日本最古老的寺庙。

en: I broke a string on my guitar.
zh: 我的吉他弦断了。

en: I am French.
zh: 我是法国人。

en: Does your dog bite?
zh: 你的狗咬人吗？

en: It's very romantic!
zh: 这太浪漫了！

en: He is very romantic!
zh: 他很浪漫！

en: I am working.
zh: 我在工作。

en: With his colored clothes, his long wig and his white gloves, one could guess he has run away from some kind of Disneyland.
zh: 看他那身彩色的衣服，长长的假发和白手套，我猜他是不是从哪个迪士尼乐园跑出来的。

en: I'd like to put my valuables in a safe deposit box, if any are available.
zh: 如果可以的话，我想把我的贵重物品放在保险箱里。

en: I have many friends.
zh: 我有很多朋友。

en: Didn't your mother teach you anything? When you meet with scary people always protect your wallet and your arsehole!
zh: 你妈妈没教过你吗？当你遇到可怕的人时，一定要保护好你的钱包和你的屁眼！

en: It has just started to snow in Vicenza.
zh: 维琴察刚开始下雪。

en: I watched Doraemon a lot when I was a kid. But I had no idea he was so large!
zh: 我小时候经常看哆啦A梦。但我不知道他这么大！

en: My name is Andrea.
zh: 我叫安德烈。

en: I love Fist of the North Star!
zh: 我喜欢《北斗神拳》！

en: In Nara there are lots of deer!
zh: 在奈良有很多鹿！

en: There are a lot of deer in Nara.
zh: 奈良有很多鹿。

en: I can't believe it.
zh: 我真不敢相信。

en: Have you ever been there?
zh: 你去过那里吗？

en: This photo was taken in Nara.
zh: 这张照片是在奈良拍的。

en: How many rocks can you see at Ryoanji?
zh: 在龙安寺你能看到多少块石头？

en: I'm stuffed!
zh: 我吃撑了！

en: This is the best kushikatsu restaurant in Osaka.
zh: 这是大阪最好吃的炸串店。

en: There was an earthquake yesterday.
zh: 昨天有地震。

en: Yesterday there was an earthquake.
zh: 昨天发生了地震。

en: It's been raining all the time recently.
zh: 最近一直在下雨。

en: Bored now.
zh: 现在好无聊。

en: How boring!
zh: 真无聊！

en: I'm going to Japan with my girlfriend in August.
zh: 我八月份要和我女朋友去日本。

en: You cannot kill yourself by holding your breath.
zh: 你憋气是憋不死自己的。

en: You should behave carefully.
zh: 你应该小心行事。

en: It seems that Mr Tanaka has passed the exam.
zh: 田中先生好像通过了考试。

en: It seems Tanaka passed her exam.
zh: 田中好像通过了她的考试。

en: But a man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.
zh: 但是人不是为了失败而生的。人可以被毁灭，但不能被打败。

en: Isn't that annoying?
zh: 你不觉得很烦吗？

en: A garden planted with pine trees.
zh: 种着松树的庭院。

en: I knew I could rely on you!
zh: 我就知道能靠你！

en: Like a thorn stuck in your throat.
zh: 如鲠在喉。

en: Just as a thorn stuck in one's throat.
zh: 就像喉咙里卡了根刺一样。

en: Money isn't everything, but if you have no money, you can't do anything.
zh: 钱不是万能的，但没有钱，你什么都做不了。

en: I think I'm gonna shit myself.
zh: 我觉得我要拉裤子了。

en: I'm bursting for a pee.
zh: 我憋不住尿了。

en: I'm dying for a piss.
zh: 我快要憋死了，想尿尿。

en: Aa, Aaaaa~~ It's about to leak.
zh: 啊，啊啊啊~~ 快要漏出来了。

en: Let's do it.
zh: 我们开始做吧。

en: Let's try it.
zh: 我们试试看。

en: Let's have a try.
zh: 我们试一下。

en: Let's try!
zh: 我们试试！

en: Let's try.
zh: 我们试试。

en: I've got to get to sleep soon.
zh: 我得赶紧睡觉了。

en: What is this shit?
zh: 这他妈的是什么玩意儿？

en: What the bloody fuck is that?
zh: 这他妈的到底是什么鬼东西？

en: The mother worried about her children.
zh: 母亲担心她的孩子们。

en: So long as I live.
zh: 只要我活着。

en: I am afraid of death.
zh: 我害怕死亡。

en: I'm afraid of death.
zh: 我害怕死亡。

en: You're all cowards.
zh: 你们都是懦夫。

en: You're all chickenshits.
zh: 你们都是胆小鬼。

en: Don't you ever come here again!
zh: 你再也不要来这里了！

en: Forget about her.
zh: 忘了她吧。

en: It's fine just the two of us. We don't need anyone else.
zh: 我们两个人就很好。我们不需要任何人。

en: Let's shackle your feet with silver fetters.
zh: 让我们用银色的镣铐锁住你的脚。

en: You don't have to worry about her anymore.
zh: 你再也不用担心她了。

en: Let's shred your wings into small pieces and throw them away.
zh: 让我们把你的翅膀撕成碎片扔掉。

en: He's sitting at the table.
zh: 他正坐在桌子旁。

en: The cat is sitting on top of the table.
zh: 猫正坐在桌子上面。

en: I'm sitting on the sofa.
zh: 我正坐在沙发上。

en: They are sitting on the lawn and the ground.
zh: 他们正坐在草坪和地上。

en: Please relax your sitting position and feel free to stretch your legs.
zh: 请放松你的坐姿，随意伸展你的腿。

en: When happiness comes knocking at your door.
zh: 当幸福来敲门的时候。

en: May happiness knock on your door.
zh: 愿幸福敲响你的门。

en: Knock on the door of one's heart.
zh: 敲开某人的心扉。

en: Knock on the door of happiness.
zh: 敲开幸福之门。

en: Knock when going to the bathroom, OK?
zh: 上厕所要敲门，好吗？

en: Let's wash our hands when leaving the toilet!
zh: 离开厕所时，让我们洗手！

en: Christmas drew near.
zh: 圣诞节临近了。

en: Christmas approached.
zh: 圣诞节临近了。

en: The new year drew closer.
zh: 新年临近了。

en: If you float a one yen coin on water and move a magnet slowly towards it then the coin will approach the magnet.
zh: 如果你把一円硬币漂浮在水面上，然后慢慢地把磁铁移向它，硬币就会靠近磁铁。

en: The enemy won't get close.
zh: 敌人无法靠近。

en: He does not let the opponent come near him.
zh: 他不让对手靠近他。

en: The enemy can't get close.
zh: 敌人无法靠近。

en: Don't let the enemy get close.
zh: 别让敌人靠近。

en: We won't approach the enemy.
zh: 我们不会接近敌人。

en: We can't get close to the enemy.
zh: 我们无法接近敌人。

en: The enemy can't close in on us so they can't do anything.
zh: 敌人无法逼近我们，所以他们什么也做不了。

en: The enemy approaches the town.
zh: 敌人逼近城镇。

en: When you're in show business for long, the number of people who can teach you something decreases every year.
zh: 如果你在演艺圈待久了，每年能教你东西的人就会减少。

en: If I do that, will everybody teach me?
zh: 如果我那样做，大家都会教我吗？

en: My surname is Zhou.
zh: 我姓周。

en: I am delighted to have met you today.
zh: 今天很高兴认识你。

en: I'm glad I met you today.
zh: 今天很高兴认识你。

en: I'm Shanghainese.
zh: 我是上海人。

en: Going off-line for a bath.
zh: 下线洗澡去了。

en: Break for bath & food, back in about 40 minutes!
zh: 休息一下，洗个澡吃点东西，大约40分钟后回来！

en: It's completely visible.
zh: 它完全可见。

en: I can hear everything.
zh: 我能听到一切。

en: Die already!
zh: 去死吧！

en: Don't worry. I'll do it.
zh: 别担心，我会做的。

en: Unable to sense the situation.
zh: 无法感知情况。

en: Let the moving finger stop on - someone who understands Japanese.
zh: 让命运之手停留在——理解日语的人身上。

en: We're coming up short on the head count!
zh: 我们的人数不够！

en: Ask my lips.
zh: 问我的嘴唇。

en: Japanese green gentian tea is very bitter.
zh: 日本绿龙胆茶非常苦。

en: Love is never without jealousy.
zh: 爱总是伴随着嫉妒。

en: The colonnade of the basilica of Saint Peter is truly grand and beautiful.
zh: 圣彼得大教堂的柱廊真是宏伟而美丽。

en: Hello, Chicago!
zh: 你好，芝加哥！

en: It's the answer told by lines that stretched around schools and churches, in numbers this nation has never seen. By people who waited three hours and four hours, many for the first time in their lives, because they believed that this time must be different, that their voices could be that difference.
zh: 这是由在学校和教堂外排起的长队所给出的答案，人数之多是这个国家前所未见的。人们等待了三个小时、四个小时，许多人一生中第一次这样做，因为他们相信这次必须有所不同，他们的声音可以成为那种不同。

en: It's the answer spoken by young and old, rich and poor, Democrat and Republican, black, white, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, gay, straight, disabled and not disabled. Americans who sent a message to the world that we have never been just a collection of individuals or a collection of red states and blue states. We are, and always will be, the United States of America.
zh: 这是年轻人和老年人、富人和穷人、民主党人和共和党人、黑人、白人、西班牙裔、亚裔、美洲原住民、同性恋、异性恋、残疾人和非残疾人所发出的答案。美国人向世界传递了一个信息，我们从来不仅仅是个人或红色州和蓝色州的集合。我们是，而且永远是，美利坚合众国。

en: It's the answer that led those who've been told for so long, by so many, to be cynical and fearful and doubtful about what we can achieve, to put their hands on the arc of history and bend it once more toward the hope of a better day.
zh: 这是那些长期以来被许多人告知要愤世嫉俗、恐惧和怀疑我们能取得什么成就的人们所给出的答案，他们将手放在历史的弧线上，再次将其弯向更美好的一天的希望。

en: It's been a long time coming; but tonight, because of what we did on this day, in this election, at this defining moment, change has come to America.
zh: 这一天已经很久了；但今晚，因为我们今天、在这个选举中、在这个决定性的时刻所做的事情，变革已经来到了美国。

en: A little bit earlier this evening, I received an extraordinarily gracious call from Senator McCain. Senator McCain fought long and hard in this campaign. And he's fought even longer and harder for the country that he loves. He has endured sacrifices for America that most of us cannot begin to imagine. We are better off for the service rendered by this brave and selfless leader.
zh: 今天晚上早些时候，我接到了麦凯恩参议员一个非常友善的电话。麦凯恩参议员在这场竞选中进行了长期而艰苦的斗争。他为他所热爱的国家进行了更长、更艰苦的斗争。他为美国做出了我们大多数人无法想象的牺牲。因为这位勇敢而无私的领导人的服务，我们变得更好了。

en: Sasha and Malia! I love you both more than you can imagine. And you have earned the new puppy that's coming with us to the White House.
zh: 萨莎和玛利亚！我爱你们胜过你们所能想象的一切。你们赢得了即将和我们一起去白宫的小狗。

en: And while she's no longer with us, I know my grandmother's watching, along with the family that made me who I am. I miss them tonight. I know that my debt to them is beyond measure. To my sister Maya, my sister Alma, all my other brothers and sisters, thank you so much for all the support that you've given me. I'm grateful to them.
zh: 虽然她已经不在我们身边了，但我知道我的祖母正在看着，还有那些成就了我的家人。今晚我很想念他们。我知道我对他们的亏欠是无法估量的。致我的妹妹玛雅，我的妹妹阿尔玛，我所有的其他兄弟姐妹，非常感谢你们给予我的所有支持。我感谢他们。

en: To my chief strategist, David Axelrod, who's been a partner with me every step of the way. To the best campaign team ever assembled in the history of politics! You made this happen, and I am forever grateful for what you've sacrificed to get it done.
zh: 致我的首席战略家大卫·阿克塞尔罗德，他一直是我每一步的伙伴。致政治史上组建的最好的竞选团队！你们成就了这一切，我永远感谢你们为完成它所做出的牺牲。

en: I was never the likeliest candidate for this office. We didn't start with much money or many endorsements. Our campaign was not hatched in the halls of Washington. It began in the backyards of Des Moines, and the living rooms of Concord, and the front porches of Charleston. It was built by working men and women who dug into what little savings they had to give $5 and $10 and $20 to the cause.
zh: 我从来都不是这个职位最有可能的候选人。我们一开始没有多少钱，也没有多少支持。我们的竞选活动不是在华盛顿的殿堂里策划的。它始于得梅因的后院、康科德的客厅和查尔斯顿的前廊。它是由工人和妇女建立的，他们挖出了他们仅有的一点积蓄，为这项事业捐赠了5美元、10美元和20美元。

en: It drew strength from the young people who rejected the myth of their generation's apathy, who left their homes and their families for jobs that offered little pay and less sleep.
zh: 它从那些拒绝他们那一代人冷漠神话的年轻人那里汲取力量，他们离开了家和家人，去从事报酬微薄、睡眠不足的工作。

en: And I know you didn't do this just to win an election. And I know you didn't do it for me. You did it because you understand the enormity of the task that lies ahead. For even as we celebrate tonight, we know the challenges that tomorrow will bring are the greatest of our lifetime: two wars, a planet in peril, the worst financial crisis in a century.
zh: 我知道你们这样做不仅仅是为了赢得选举。我知道你们这样做不是为了我。你们这样做是因为你们理解摆在我们面前的任务的艰巨性。因为即使我们今晚庆祝，我们也知道明天将带来的挑战是我们一生中最严峻的挑战：两场战争，一个处于危险中的星球，一个世纪以来最严重的金融危机。

en: Even as we stand here tonight, we know there are brave Americans waking up in the deserts of Iraq and the mountains of Afghanistan, to risk their lives for us.
zh: 即使我们今晚站在这里，我们也知道有勇敢的美国人正在伊拉克沙漠和阿富汗山区醒来，为我们冒着生命危险。

en: There are mothers and fathers who will lie awake after the children fall asleep and wonder how they'll make the mortgage, or pay their doctor's bills, or save enough for their child's college education.
zh: 总有一些父母会在孩子们入睡后仍然无法入眠，他们会为如何偿还抵押贷款、支付医疗账单，或者为孩子攒够大学学费而苦恼。

en: The road ahead will be long. Our climb will be steep. We may not get there in one year or even in one term. But, America, I have never been more hopeful than I am tonight that we WILL get there.
zh: 前方的道路将是漫长的。我们的攀登将是陡峭的。我们可能无法在一年内，甚至一个任期内到达目标。但是，美国，我从未像今晚这样充满希望，我们终将到达。

en: There will be setbacks and false starts. There are many who won't agree with every decision or policy I make as president. And we know the government can't solve every problem.
zh: 前进的道路上会有挫折和失败。很多人不会同意我作为总统所做的每一个决定或政策。而且我们知道政府无法解决所有问题。

en: But I will always be honest with you about the challenges we face. I will listen to you, especially when we disagree. And above all, I will ask you to join in the work of remaking this nation, the only way it's been done in America for 221 years; block by block, brick by brick, calloused hand by calloused hand.
zh: 但我将始终坦诚地告诉你们我们面临的挑战。我会倾听你们的声音，尤其是在我们意见不一致的时候。最重要的是，我将请求你们加入到重建这个国家的工作中来，就像过去221年来在美国所做的那样：一块砖一块砖地垒砌，一双双布满老茧的手共同努力。

en: What began 21 months ago in the depths of winter cannot end on this autumn night. This victory alone is not the change we seek. It is only the chance for us to make that change. And that cannot happen if we go back to the way things were. It can't happen without you, without a new spirit of service, a new spirit of sacrifice. So let us summon a new spirit of patriotism, of responsibility, where each of us resolves to pitch in and work harder and look after not only ourselves but each other.
zh: 21个月前在寒冬中开始的事业，不能在这个秋夜结束。仅仅这场胜利并不是我们所寻求的改变。它只是我们做出改变的机会。如果我们回到过去的老路，这一切就不会发生。没有你们，没有新的服务精神，新的牺牲精神，这一切就不会发生。所以，让我们唤起一种新的爱国主义精神，一种责任感，让我们每个人都下定决心，贡献自己的力量，更加努力地工作，不仅要照顾好自己，也要照顾好彼此。

en: Let us remember that if this financial crisis taught us anything, it's that we cannot have a thriving Wall Street while Main Street suffers.
zh: 让我们记住，如果这场金融危机教会了我们什么，那就是当华尔街繁荣时，我们不能容忍美国大街的萧条。

en: In this country, we rise or fall as one nation, as one people. Let's resist the temptation to fall back on the same partisanship and pettiness and immaturity that has poisoned our politics for so long.
zh: 在这个国家，我们荣辱与共，休戚相关。让我们抵制住诱惑，不要再回到那些长期毒害我们政治的党派之争、小肚鸡肠和不成熟的做法。

en: Let's remember that it was a man from this state who first carried the banner of the Republican Party to the White House, a party founded on the values of self-reliance and individual liberty and national unity. Those are values that we all share. And while the Democratic Party has won a great victory tonight, we do so with a measure of humility and determination to heal the divides that have held back our progress.
zh: 让我们记住，正是来自这个州的一位人士，首次将共和党的旗帜带到了白宫，这个政党建立在自力更生、个人自由和国家团结的价值观之上。这些价值观是我们共同拥有的。虽然民主党今晚赢得了伟大的胜利，但我们怀着谦逊的态度和决心来弥合那些阻碍我们进步的分歧。

en: As Lincoln said to a nation far more divided than ours, we are not enemies but friends. Though passion may have strained, it must not break our bonds of affection.
zh: 正如林肯对一个比我们更加分裂的国家所说的那样，我们不是敌人，而是朋友。即使激情可能已经紧张，但它绝不能打破我们之间的情谊。

en: And to those Americans whose support I have yet to earn, I may not have won your vote tonight, but I hear your voices. I need your help. And I will be your president, too.
zh: 对于那些尚未赢得支持的美国人，我可能没有赢得你们今晚的选票，但我听到了你们的声音。我需要你们的帮助。我也会成为你们的总统。

en: And all those watching tonight from beyond our shores, from parliaments and palaces, to those who are huddled around radios in the forgotten corners of the world, our stories are singular, but our destiny is shared, and a new dawn of American leadership is at hand.
zh: 对于今晚所有在海外关注着我们的人们，从议会和宫殿，到那些聚集在世界被遗忘的角落里收听广播的人们，我们的故事是独特的，但我们的命运是共同的，美国领导的新时代即将到来。

en: To those who would tear the world down: we will defeat you.
zh: 对于那些想要摧毁世界的人：我们将击败你们。

en: To those who seek peace and security. We support you. And to all those who have wondered if America's beacon still burns as bright, tonight we proved once more that the true strength of our nation comes not from the might of our arms or the scale of our wealth, but from the enduring power of our ideals: democracy, liberty, opportunity and unyielding hope.
zh: 对于那些寻求和平与安全的人们：我们支持你们。对于所有那些想知道美国的灯塔是否仍然明亮的人们，今晚我们再次证明，我们国家真正的力量不是来自我们强大的军队或巨大的财富，而是来自我们理想的持久力量：民主、自由、机会和永不放弃的希望。

en: That's the true genius of America; that America can change. Our Union can be perfected. What we've already achieved gives us hope for what we can and must achieve tomorrow.
zh: 这就是美国真正的天才之处：美国可以改变。我们的联邦可以变得更加完美。我们已经取得的成就让我们对我们能够并且必须在明天取得的成就充满希望。

en: This election had many firsts and many stories that will be told for generations. But one that's on my mind tonight is about a woman who cast her ballot in Atlanta. She's a lot like the millions of others who stood in line to make their voice heard in this election, except for one thing: Ann Nixon Cooper is 106 years old.
zh: 这次选举有很多第一次，也有很多故事将被世代传颂。但今晚我想到的是一位在亚特兰大投票的女性。她和数百万排队投票、表达自己声音的人们很相似，但有一点不同：安·尼克松·库珀今年106岁了。

en: She was born just a generation past slavery. A time when there were no cars on the road or planes in the sky, when someone like her couldn't vote for two reasons: because she was a woman, and because of the color of her skin.
zh: 她出生在奴隶制结束后的下一代。那时路上没有汽车，天上没有飞机，像她这样的人不能投票，原因有两个：因为她是女性，而且因为她的肤色。

en: And tonight, I think about all that she's seen throughout her century in America. The heartache and the hope, the struggle and the progress. The times we were told that we can't, and the people who pressed on with that American creed: Yes, we can.
zh: 今晚，我想到了她在美国的一个世纪里所看到的一切。心痛和希望，奋斗和进步。我们被告知我们不能的时代，以及那些坚持美国信条的人们：是的，我们能。

en: At a time when women's voices were silenced and their hopes dismissed, she lived to see them stand up and speak out and reach for the ballot. Yes, we can.
zh: 在女性的声音被压制，她们的希望被忽视的时代，她活着看到了她们站起来，发出声音，争取投票权。是的，我们能。

en: When there was despair in the dust bowl and depression across the land, she saw a nation conquer fear itself with a New Deal, new jobs, a new sense of common purpose. Yes, we can.
zh: 当尘暴带来绝望，萧条席卷大地时，她看到一个国家通过新政、新的就业机会和新的共同目标战胜了恐惧本身。是的，我们能。

en: When the bombs fell on our harbor and tyranny threatened the world, she was there to witness a generation rise to greatness, and a democracy was saved. Yes, we can.
zh: 当炸弹落在我们的港口，暴政威胁世界时，她在那里见证了一代人崛起为伟大，民主得以拯救。是的，我们能。

en: She was there for the buses in Montgomery, the hoses in Birmingham, a bridge in Selma, and a preacher from Atlanta who told a people that "We Shall Overcome." Yes, we can.
zh: 她在蒙哥马利的公共汽车上，在伯明翰的水枪下，在塞尔玛的桥上，以及来自亚特兰大的牧师告诉人们“我们终将克服”的地方。是的，我们能。

en: A man touched down on the moon. A wall came down in Berlin. A world was connected by our own science and imagination.
zh: 一个人登上了月球。柏林墙倒塌了。一个世界通过我们自己的科学和想象力连接在一起。

en: And this year, in this election, she touched her finger to a screen, and cast her vote; because after 106 years in America, through the best of times and the darkest of hours, she knows how America can change.
zh: 今年，在这次选举中，她用手指触摸屏幕，投下了她的选票；因为在美国生活了106年后，经历了最好的时代和最黑暗的时刻，她知道美国是如何改变的。

en: Yes, we can.
zh: 是的，我们能。

en: America, we have come so far. We have seen so much. But there is so much more to do. So tonight, let us ask ourselves, if our children should live to see the next century, if my daughters should be so lucky to live as long as Ann Nixon Cooper, what change will they see? What progress will we have made?
zh: 美国，我们已经走了这么远。我们已经看到了这么多。但还有很多事情要做。所以今晚，让我们问问自己，如果我们的孩子能够活到下一个世纪，如果我的女儿们足够幸运，能够像安·尼克松·库珀一样长寿，她们将会看到什么样的改变？我们将取得什么样的进步？

en: This is our chance to answer that call. This is our moment. This is our time, to put our people back to work and open doors of opportunity for our kids; to restore prosperity and promote the cause of peace; to reclaim the American dream and reaffirm that fundamental truth, that out of many, we are one; that while we breathe, we hope. And where we are met with cynicism and doubt and those who tell us that we can't, we will respond with that timeless creed that sums up the spirit of a people.
zh: 现在是我们回应召唤的机会。这是我们的时刻。现在是我们的时代，让我们的人民重返工作岗位，为我们的孩子敞开机会之门；恢复繁荣，促进和平事业；重拾美国梦，重申那个基本真理，即我们由多合一；只要我们呼吸，我们就充满希望。当面对那些嘲讽、怀疑和告诉我们“我们不行”的人时，我们将用那句概括人民精神的永恒信条来回应。

en: Thank you. God bless you. And may God bless the United States of America.
zh: 谢谢。上帝保佑你们。愿上帝保佑美利坚合众国。

en: This is everyone's victory.
zh: 这是每个人的胜利。

en: Must be nice...
zh: 真好啊...

en: Welcome!
zh: 欢迎！

en: It looked cheap.
zh: 看起来很廉价。

en: Kibune is in Kyoto.
zh: 贵船在京都。

en: This restaurant is located on the riverbed.
zh: 这家餐厅位于河床上。

en: All of it was delicious!
zh: 所有的都很好吃！

en: It was all delicious!
zh: 所有的都很好吃！

en: Do you have any condoms?
zh: 你们有避孕套吗？

en: It's nice out today, isn't it?
zh: 今天天气真好，不是吗？

en: It's considered to be an important matter.
zh: 这被认为是一件重要的事情。

en: My hovercraft is full of eels.
zh: 我的气垫船装满了鳗鱼。

en: I will keep you warm.
zh: 我会让你暖和的。

en: Next summer, I want to go to Hawaii.
zh: 明年夏天，我想去夏威夷。

en: Has anybody here been to Hawaii?
zh: 这里有人去过夏威夷吗？

en: I recommend Maui.
zh: 我推荐茂宜岛。

en: I'd like to go to Hawaii as well.
zh: 我也想去夏威夷。

en: I do not understand.
zh: 我不明白。

en: I don't understand.
zh: 我不明白。

en: In Venice, there are always lots of tourists.
zh: 在威尼斯，总是有很多游客。

en: Somehow I just can't accept that.
zh: 不知怎的，我就是无法接受。

en: Why do you consider that incident important?
zh: 你为什么认为那件事很重要？

en: He's very soft-hearted.
zh: 他心很软。

en: Can your mom drive a car?
zh: 你妈妈会开车吗？

en: I eat noodles.
zh: 我吃面条。

en: I am eating noodles.
zh: 我在吃面条。

en: One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten.
zh: 一，二，三，四，五，六，七，八，九，十。

en: Please wash your hands properly before eating.
zh: 请饭前正确洗手。

en: Frankly, I don't like that man.
zh: 坦白说，我不喜欢那个人。

en: No swimming.
zh: 禁止游泳。

en: This is a no-swimming zone.
zh: 这里是禁止游泳区域。

en: Swimming is prohibited here.
zh: 此处禁止游泳。

en: Please don't follow this advice.
zh: 请不要听从这个建议。

en: He closed the door.
zh: 他关上了门。

en: He shut the door.
zh: 他关上了门。

en: It takes about 10 minutes to get to the train station by foot.
zh: 走路到火车站大约需要十分钟。

en: Take a good look, I'll show you how it's done.
zh: 好好看着，我来教你怎么做。

en: Ten, eleven, twelve, thirteen, fourteen, fifteen, sixteen, seventeen, eighteen, nineteen, twenty.
zh: 十，十一，十二，十三，十四，十五，十六，十七，十八，十九，二十。

en: The whole class is present today.
zh: 今天全班都到齐了。

en: Everyone in the class is here today.
zh: 今天班里的每个人都来了。

en: Suddenly my heart hurts.
zh: 突然我心脏疼。

en: I forced her to do my homework.
zh: 我强迫她帮我做作业。

en: I'm sorry I'm late replying to your email.
zh: 很抱歉我回复你的邮件晚了。

en: I met you; that is enough.
zh: 我遇见了你，这就足够了。

en: Cup ramen are bad for your health.
zh: 方便面不益于健康。

en: Cold water, please.
zh: 请给我一杯冷水。

en: This town's way of thinking is rotten.
zh: 这个镇的思维方式腐朽了。

en: The future is far more practical than I imagined.
zh: 未来比我想象的要实际得多。

en: Act faster!
zh: 动作快点！

en: The world which I saw in my dream was a peaceful world devoid of war.
zh: 我在梦中看到的世界是一个没有战争的和平世界。

en: When I want to cry, I think of you.
zh: 当我想哭的时候，我会想起你。

en: Just the sound of 'I love you' makes me feel stronger.
zh: 仅仅是听到“我爱你”的声音，就让我感觉更坚强。

en: I'm not your doll.
zh: 我不是你的玩偶。

en: After all, I'm a waste of space.
zh: 毕竟，我只是个废物。

en: There's nothing worse than doing things by halves!!
zh: 没有比半途而废更糟糕的事情了！！

en: There is nothing worse than doing something in a half-hearted manner.
zh: 没有比做事半途而废更糟糕的事情了。

en: The worst thing you can do is to only do something half seriously.
zh: 你能做的最糟糕的事情就是做事不认真。

en: Doing something only half-heartedly is the worst thing you can do.
zh: 做事半途而废是你所能做的最糟糕的事情。

en: Leaving something unfinished is the worst thing you can do.
zh: 留下未完成的事情是你所能做的最糟糕的事情。

en: A person cannot understand another person completely.
zh: 人无法完全理解另一个人。

en: But the person in charge is there precisely to take responsibility.
zh: 但是负责人正因为要承担责任才在那里。

en: I understand, but I cannot agree.
zh: 我理解，但我不能同意。

en: However that's only for handsome men.
zh: 然而那只适用于帅哥。

en: The heavens do not create men that are more than men, nor do they create men that are less than men.
zh: 上天不会创造比人更伟大的人，也不会创造比人更渺小的人。

en: All people shall have the right to maintain the minimum standards of wholesome and cultured living.
zh: 所有的人都应有权维持最低限度的健康而有文化的生活水准。

en: I'm sorry, I love you.
zh: 对不起，我爱你。

en: Please go at the most convenient time for you.
zh: 请在您最方便的时间去。

en: If you know the answer to this question, please tell me.
zh: 如果你知道这个问题的答案，请告诉我。

en: No place like home.
zh: 金窝银窝不如自己的狗窝。

en: Good medicine is bitter.
zh: 良药苦口。

en: Yesterday was Tuesday, 2010, January the 26th.
zh: 昨天是2010年1月26日，星期二。

en: Yesterday was Tuesday, January 26, 2010.
zh: 昨天是2010年1月26日，星期二。

en: It was freezing!
zh: 太冷了！

en: It was very cold.
zh: 天气很冷。

en: It was really cold.
zh: 天气真冷。

en: It was quite cold.
zh: 天气相当冷。

en: It was like a bolt out of the blue.
zh: 这真是晴天霹雳。

en: I wonder if he'll come tomorrow.
zh: 我想知道他明天会不会来。

en: A drowning man will catch at a straw.
zh: 病急乱投医。

en: The darkest place is under the candlestick.
zh: 最黑暗的地方在烛台下。

en: Nothing comes of nothing.
zh: 无中生有。

en: You're a human.
zh: 你是一个人。

en: You're a person.
zh: 你是一个人。

en: Tuesday was certainly cold.
zh: 星期二确实很冷。

en: It was so cold my ears hurt.
zh: 太冷了，我的耳朵都疼了。

en: Like his father, he has many books.
zh: 和他父亲一样，他有很多书。

en: What would you do if you met a person from another planet?
zh: 如果你遇到来自其他星球的人，你会怎么做？

en: I forgot to ask him.
zh: 我忘了问他。

en: Don't hide under the bed.
zh: 不要躲在床底下。

en: What's he talking about?
zh: 他在说什么？

en: Much confusion ensued following this news report.
zh: 这条新闻报道之后，引起了很多混乱。

en: At Papa South, you can eat delicious homestyle food.
zh: 在南方老爹餐厅，你可以吃到美味的家常菜。

en: Thank you for the corrections.
zh: 谢谢你的更正。

en: It's too late to do anything about that now.
zh: 现在做任何事情都太晚了。

en: That house is really better than this house.
zh: 那栋房子确实比这栋房子好。

en: I hope to go to Japan and beat the Japanese in mahjong.
zh: 我希望去日本并在麻将比赛中击败日本人。

en: Why can't Go be popular in Turkey when it is so in Japan?
zh: 围棋在日本如此流行，为什么在土耳其却不能流行呢？

en: That room is filled with a cloud of cigarette smoke.
zh: 那个房间里充满了烟雾。

en: I sometimes wonder if I am a girl.
zh: 我有时会想，我是不是个女孩。

en: I think, therefore I am.
zh: 我思故我在。

en: At about what age do the Japanese marry?
zh: 日本人大约在什么年龄结婚？

en: I would love to write hundreds of sentences on Tatoeba, but I've got things to do.
zh: 我很想在Tatoeba上写几百个句子，但我还有事情要做。

en: In Sumerian "LÚ.GAL" means the ruler or king.
zh: 在苏美尔语中，“LÚ.GAL”的意思是统治者或国王。

en: I'm fed up with this winter, I want spring right now!
zh: 我受够了这个冬天，我现在就想要春天！

en: This is, even now, an unrealized dream.
zh: 即使是现在，这仍然是一个未实现的梦想。

en: Too bad.
zh: 太可惜了。

en: Achoo!
zh: 阿嚏！

en: Answer accurately in one go.
zh: 一次性准确回答。

en: See you next time!
zh: 下次见！

en: See you.
zh: 再见。

en: Catch you later.
zh: 回头见。

en: See you!
zh: 再见！

en: See you later.
zh: 待会儿见。

en: The funny thing about age is that while everyone was young once, not everyone will get old.
zh: 年龄这东西有趣的是，虽然每个人都年轻过，但不是每个人都会变老。

en: You can study, no matter your age.
zh: 无论你多大年纪，都可以学习。

en: No matter how old you get, you can still learn.
zh: 无论你多大年纪，你仍然可以学习。

en: It doesn't matter how old you get, you can learn.
zh: 无论你多大年纪，你都可以学习。

en: Compile an essay on that topic within a fixed number of letters.
zh: 用规定的字数写一篇关于这个主题的文章。

en: In spring, the dawn.
zh: 春天，是黎明。

en: He can't sing well.
zh: 他唱歌不好听。

en: Although she is gone, I still love her more than anything.
zh: 虽然她已经走了，但我仍然比任何事物都爱她。

en: I'm good at Japanese.
zh: 我擅长日语。

en: Exercise every day.
zh: 每天锻炼。
